title: Higher Education Mathematics Remote E-Learning: Text Analysis and Expression Training for Logical Language Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic mathematical and logical concepts, ability to identify fundamental grammatical structures, experience with simple text analysis
context.additional_context: Supplemental program for computer science master's degree applicants, designed to address deficiencies in logical language comprehension. Participated by students nationwide in Mexico, with a focus on improving mathematical text reading comprehension and logical expression skills

learning_goals: Students can accurately interpret the basic structure of logical language (propositions, logical connectives, quantifiers) and apply it to mathematical proofs.
Through team-based collaborative learning, students analyze the textual structure of complex mathematical problems, apply logical reasoning, and actively participate in the problem-solving process.

Learners can mathematically model three real-world problems in computer engineering (e.g., algorithms, network optimization), implement the models in Python code to pass over 80% of test cases, and clearly explain the process in logical language.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
